oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York family and Gov. Prentice Cooper at "Sergeant York" premiere

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motion picture premieres; Motion picture theaters; Theaters; Spectators; People; Governors
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture); Cooper, Prentice, 1895-1969; Knickerbocker Theatre (Nashville, Tenn.); Storer, Walter Henry, 1898-1974
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin C. York, his wife Gracie, other York family members, Gov. Prentice Cooper, and onlookers are pictured in front of the Knickerbocker Theatre at the Nashville premiere of the movie "Sergeant York."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Storer, Walter Henry, 1898-1974
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Dr. Walter H. Storer Photograph Collection, ca. 1930-1955
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Warner Brothers officially premiered "Sergeant York" at the Astor Theatre in New York City on July 2, 1941, and released it to theaters nationwide on September 27, 1941. The film had been in production from February to May of 1941.
